page.title: 08THE FEUARS
page.content: The Feuars formed in 1805 is a body of nine persons elected from among holders of perpectual leases to manage the affairs of the village for the common good. A School and mill were given to them conditionally on payment of Â£4 interest on cost of building to Geo Dempster who also gave them bleaching greens,grazing and a 'plash' mill to administer.Rent from these was to be divided between maintaining village roads and any purpose they themselves decided.Votng was secret using a voting stick an example of which may be seen in Glamis Folk Museum. Now all but a few roads are maintained by Tayside Region. The first Chairman was George Dempster of Dunnichen.In 1985 the chairperson is Mrs Irene McLaren.
